title.narrative: EDY - Tusome Early Grade Reading Program

description.narrative: (Kenya): .The new basic education activity will build on the success of the Tusome ("Let's Read" in Kiswahili) early grade reading program. It will expand interventions in English and Kiswahili for grades four to six throughout Kenya and help students in grades one to three reach higher levels of reading fluency through additional support. Using FY 2019 funds, activities may include teaching and learning materials development, technical assistance to Government of Kenya (GOK) officials, building the capacity of Kenyan publishing and printing companies, working with local youth organizations to promote a culture of reading, and a rigorous monitoring and evaluation platform to build the GOK capacity to assess student learning outcomes and use the data for decision and policy making. In support of Kenya's Journey to Self-Reliance, the new activity will build upon Tusome's strong foundation of host-country ownership, financing, and a long-term return on investment, as stated in the GOK's five-year Medium Term Plan. The new basic education activity will be co-designed with the GOK and other stakeholders to meet the priorities of Kenya's 2018-2022 National Education Sector Strategic Plan, the U.S. Global Strategy for Basic Education, and USAID's Education Policy to ensure USAID's investment in basic education leverages GOK financial and political commitment. USAID's demonstrated leadership and partnership with the GOK in developing foundational language and literacy skills through the full primary cycle in the Kenyan education system advances U.S. influence in Kenya. New activities will support the Joint Strategic Plan objective to "promote healthy, educated, and productive populations" by developing skills that enable academic success and eventual employment..
